word.definition: uninteresting
word.example: He gave a long, boring talk.

word.definition: pleasant and relaxing to wear, sit in, spend time in, etc.
word.example: The hotel bed was not very comfortable.

word.definition: one of the separate parts of a meal
word.example: The first course was soup.

word.definition: very pleasant to eat
word.example: Try the cakes – they’re delicious.

word.definition: sweet food eaten at the end of a meal
word.example: I’ll have ice cream for dessert.

word.definition: the main meal of the day, usually eaten in the evening
word.example: She took her team out to dinner to celebrate.

word.definition: a type of food prepared as part of a meal
word.example: The restaurant is known for its fish dishes.

word.definition: fairly good or acceptable
word.example: The flight was fine, but I’m quite tired now.

word.definition: a meal eaten in the middle of the day
word.example: Jenny has gone to lunch but she’ll be back soon.

word.definition: a company that produces goods in large quantities
word.example: He works for a well-known computer manufacturer.

word.definition: a time when people sit down to eat food, for example breakfast, lunch, or dinner
word.example: What time do you usually have your evening meal?

word.definition: to be in the same place as sb and talk to them
word.example: We’ve talked on the phone, but I’ve never met her.

word.definition: a list of the food that is available at a restaurant
word.example: Can we see the menu, please?

word.definition: pleasant or enjoyable
word.example: We had a really nice time at the party.

word.definition: a drink that does not contain alcohol
word.example: Would you like a glass of wine, or a soft drink?

word.definition: water with bubbles of gas in it
word.example: Do you prefer still or sparkling water?

word.definition: water without bubbles of gas in it
word.example: A bottle of still water, please.

word.definition: a company or person that supplies goods to companies
word.example: We are a leading supplier of office stationery.

word.definition: very bad or unpleasant
word.example: The weather has been terrible all week.

word.definition: cloth produced by weaving or knitting
word.example: The factory produces a range of textiles.

word.definition: a small amount of extra money that you give to sb who helps you, for example a waiter in a restaurant
word.example: Should I leave a tip?

word.definition: an event where many companies show and sell their products
word.example: This is the biggest travel trade fair in Europe.

word.definition: a person who works in a restaurant bringing food and drinks to customers
word.example: The waiter brought us a basket of bread.

word.definition: a woman who works in a restaurant bringing food and drinks to customers
word.example: A waitress showed us to our table.
